Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Can I take additional classes while I'm in the IBC?
Yes, but it is not recommended and will most likely affect your IBC grades negatively. Most of the work in the IBC is done in groups and companies. All four IBC instructors use peer evaluations so the grades you receive in the IBC are heavily weighted by what your team and company say about your contribution. If you are not able to help your team or company as much as others because of other classes, your grades will suffer.
 
Can I have a job while I am in the IBC?
Yes, but, as with taking other classes, if you are not able to contribute the time necessary to create and grow your business, your peers will evaluate you lower and your grades will suffer. If you must work, we suggest you will find a way to minimize your hours or change your work schedule to not interfere with the needs of your company and team.
 
I have a business idea already, can I use it?
You will be assigned to a company of between 20 and 25 other people. You will need to convince them that your idea is better than the ideas brought forward by the other company members.
